alert.note: Alert for Coastal Miami Dade County; Far South Miami-Dade County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 03 at 4:14PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Miami-Dade County through 445 PM EDT... At 413 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout 9 miles southeast of Royal Palm Ranger, or 10 miles northwest of Jewfish Creek Bridge, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, wind gusts up to 50 mph, and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Turkey Point and Ocean Reef. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes. Funnel clouds can touch down and produce waterspouts. Although typically weak and short lived, a landfalling waterspout can cause property damage and serious injury.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Miami Dade County; Far South Miami-Dade County
